titleStmt.title: The bloody game at cards, as it was played betwixt the King of Hearts. And the rest of his suite, against the residue of the packe of cards. Wherein is discovered where faire play; was plaid and where was fowle.

publicationStmt.publisher: Shuffled at London, cut at Westminster, dealt at Yorke, and plaid in the open field. by the citty-club, the country spade-men, rich-diamond men and loyall hearted men.,

notesStmt.note: A satire in support of Charles I.
Place and date of publication from Wing.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

person.persName: the citty-club, the country spade-men, rich-diamond men and loyall hearted men.

place.placeName: London, cut at Westminster, dealt at Yorke
